summary: Til Death Do Us Part... - Life with Robb 4 (on Wattpad) https://my.w.tt/3P6BRgY2VQ  Ilva the Winter had always imagined her...
caption:
Til Death Do Us Part… - Life with Robb 4 (on Wattpad) https://my.w.tt/3P6BRgY2VQ 

Ilva the Winter had always imagined her wedding day to be the most beautiful day of her life. And even though she loves Jon Snow more than anything else in the world, she can’t help missing the man she had planned this wedding with. But Robb Stark died on a battlefield far away from home and Ilva can only hope that he’s proud of her now. Ilva can only hope that he’s proud of her and Jon now. 

*A modern Game of Thrones fanfiction with a female OC describing the wedding day and Ilva’s life with Robb and with Jon*

summary: Hello, I was discussing ASOIAF Catelyn and Jon in person with someone and they brought up a point I don't think I saw online....
question: Hello, I was discussing ASOIAF Catelyn and Jon in person with someone and they brought up a point I don't think I saw online. House Stark had a period of infighting for Winterfell. But all of those people were legitimate. We don't hear anything about Lonnel Snow trying anything. Their argument was that Catelyn should have been less worried about a bastard son and more worried if she died and Ned tried to remarry. The situation is obviously more complex and personal though than just that. Thanks.
answer:
The Blackfyre Rebellions. Full stop.

An overambitious high born bastard decided to kinslay his way through his relatives until he could be king- a century old conflict that ended a few years before Catlyn Tully was born. Catlyn would have grown up hearing war stories from her father and uncle and even referred to Daemon Blackfyre in canon when she objected to Robb legitimizing Jon Snow in his will.

Riding north with her son, Catlyn Stark has left her home, her family, and her gods to make a marriage with a solemn stranger. She is an outsider. She only knew her husband in the stories Brandon told her and for a few scant weeks after the wedding.

She enters Winterfell and finds a Stark looking bastard boy installed where her son should be. A boy her new lord husband favors and refuses to discuss or send away.

Catlyn Stark is not going to considering a centuries old Stark succession crisis; her mind is going to flash back to the war stories her father and uncle told her- how one bastard caused enough conflict to last generations.

She is going to think about how she is a stranger here, with a Tully looking son, and wonder what she has to look forward to.

summary: Part 13[[MORE]] As the months past Y/n could no longer deny that she was with child, there was gossip that she fell pregnant...
caption:
Part 13

As the months past Y/n could no longer deny that she was with child, there was gossip that she fell pregnant very quickly and speculated that she and Robb had been intimate before they were married. Catelyn was not a stranger to the news of what had been talked about around Winterfell; she felt it was her duty to ask her son whether the rumours were right. Robb did as he promised for Y/n and told his mother that he and Y/n had slept together before she left for King’s Landing; that he had taken her maidenhead and the child she was carrying was his. His mother could not hide her disappointment with both Robb and Y/n, she thought her son had been raised better than sleep with the queen’s sister but she did not stay angry with the pair for long. After all it was Y/n that saved the lives of her child and her husband, she was bitter that she could no longer be with her husband, Catelyn was relieved that he was still alive.

There were times that Y/n felt saddened that she had allowed Robb to cover the fact that Jon was the father of her child. Feeling guilty that she could not tell him of her situation, if her family had learnt what had really happened then Jon’s life would be forfeit.

She and Robb had become close over the coming months, although it had taken her some time to open up, sometimes she was angry with herself that she had stopped Robb from marrying someone he really wanted to be with. They had yet to be intimate with one another, most assumed that she and Robb were madly in love with one another but were nothing but friends. Y/n had been pleased that she had married a man that respected her; he was kind and gentle with her and did not force her to do anything she was not comfortable with.

It had taken Robb some time to settle with his new role as Lord Stark of Winterfell, he often worried that he was not good enough and that his father would be disappointed in him. But both Y/n and Catelyn had reassured him that he was doing a good job and that Ned would be proud of him.

They had received a raven from Ned himself telling his family that he was safe and had arrived at Winterfell, Y/n wondered if Jon knew about her marriage to his brother and hoped that he would not judge her for her actions. She wished she could explain it all to him but it was too late for that, Y/n knew that he would have taken his vows and it would not make a difference. For Robb she had to forget and move on with her life, she had married Robb and promised that she would make the marriage work.

Y/n was almost nine moons into her pregnancy, her belly had swelled and she was finding it hard to move around Winterfell as she used to. Rob and his family had been kind to her, although at times Y/n thought she did not deserve it, after all she had been lying who the true father of her child was. At times she worried that people would find out what had happened, especially her nephew Joffrey, scared that he would send men for Jon’s head. None of her family had truly cared for her except Tyrion, he had visited her a few times since her marriage, and he stayed for several weeks before returning to King’s Landing. Both her father and Cersei sent ravens upon hearing the news that she was with child, therefore sealing her future as the Lady of Winterfell. Y/n had always dreamt that she had another family elsewhere, that in fact she had been taken as a child; which would explain why her family treated her so cruelly. It was Tyrion that was always by her side when she grew up, as everyone else would treat them as outcasts, as if they had something to be ashamed about.

Her one fear had been that she would die as her mother had in childbirth, Y/n did not want to suffer the same fate, she wanted to her child grow and thrive. She would fill her child’s life with so much love and joy, reminding them that they were loved and that they were wanted.

As her pregnancy was soon coming to an end it was advised that Y/n remain only in her rooms, not to venture outside as they worried that she may slip, fall and injury herself or her child. Rob had been there when he first felt their child move and kick against his palm. Many times she would awake and find Rob talking to her unborn child; she knew that he would be an amazing father. Y/n hoped that one day she would carry his child, to be a good wife to him as she hoped her heart would heal and open up to him.

That afternoon Y/n sat by the fire, it was growing colder, Robb was right; winter is coming. Sansa sat with her, keeping her company as they stitch together. They sat talking quietly as they shared stories with one another, Sansa telling her stories of Robb as they grew up together. As Y/n giggled along to Sansa’s story she felt a sharp pain in her stomach before she felt something wet escaping between her thighs. Sansa watches Y/n as she grimaces, a smile longer on Y/n’s face or her soft laughter filling the room.

‘Y/n, are you well?’

‘I think the baby is coming, Sansa I need you to find your mother and tell her. We need the master or Septa’

‘Now?’

‘Yes, the baby is coming please’

‘Yes, Yes I will’ Sansa nervously replies, Y/n can see the fear in the young girl’s eyes.

‘Sansa it’s going to be alright, it will be a little while before the baby will be here. There is nothing to worry about. Could you help me out of the chair I need to get to the bed?’

Sansa quickly nods as she takes Y/n’s hands and careful pulls her up out of the seat, Y/n slowly waddles to the bed as she watches Sansa rush out of the room. She quietly chuckles to herself as she unties her gown; she places it onto her wooden chest before pulling the sheets down the bed; Y/n did not wish to ruin the furs. Catelyn had once told her what it was like to give birth, but inside it not ease the nervousness she felt inside scared she would suffer the same fate as her mother. As Y/n

waited patiently on the bed Sansa quickly returned with Rob following behind her, a worried expression on his face.

‘What happened? Are you alright? Is the baby really coming’ he burst out, making Y/n smile as he moved towards her.

‘I’m fine Rob; the baby will be here soon, my waters have broken. Sansa did you find your mother?’

‘Yes..’ Sansa replies followed by a sigh as she tries to catch her breath ‘She has gone in search of the Maester and Septa?’

‘Thank you Sansa’

Rob brushes Y/n’s hair from her face as he looks into her eyes; it was as if he could sense her emotions and how she was feeling.

‘It’s going to be alright Y/n, I will not allow anything to happen to you’ he promises ‘I will stay by your side as long as it takes’

‘I do not think your mother would allow that Rob’

‘I am the Lord of Winterfell now and I wish to stay with my wife’

Her heart swells as he puts his foot down, sometimes his mother would tell him how to run Winterfell, Y/n knew she was only advising him the best way but sometimes it drove him mad. But Y/n was right Catelyn had tried to force Rob to leave their room, but there was nothing they could to make him leave. Instead he took a chair and sat by the bed as he held her hand, she could have wished for a better husband; caring and loving. Y/n knew that Rob was falling for her; she could see it in his eyes when he looked at her. She could feel herself falling for him also but hoped that she would forget about Jon and not compare the brothers.

Rob was there throughout the birth, he held onto her hand as she pushed her baby into the world, a beautiful little girl. Her daughter had a beautiful head of dark hair, she wondered if one day it would be as dark as her fathers. Rob and Y/n had already discussed what names she would like for their baby, but there was only one name that stood out for Y/n. She named her daughter Joanna after her mother, she knew her father would be furious but Y/n wished to honour her late mother.

‘She is so beautiful’ Rob told her as he watched his wife hold Joanna in her arms ‘I did not know they could be so small’

‘Would you like to hold her?’

‘What if I drop her?’

‘Rob you will not drop her, do not worry. Just copy what I am doing’ she promises as she places the small bundle in his arms. Y/n is cleaned up by the septa and her lady in waiting as the maids clear their bed, placing fresh sheets onto the mattress. Y/n watches from a distance as Rob cradles Joanna in his arms, a soft smile on his face as she sleeps quietly.

Y/n is asked if she would like a wet nurse for her a daughter but her answer is immediately no, that she wishes to nurse her own child. They are taken aback but Rob smirks as she takes Joanna and

watches curiously as the baby suckles onto her breast. It is the first time he has seen something so intimate; he had caught glimpses of Y/n naked on several occasions when she bathed but had never without her consent. The couple are left alone together as they finally breathe a sigh of relief that both mother and child are safe.

‘Thank you Rob for staying with me, I could not have done this without you’

‘I would rather be by your side than anywhere else’ he tells her, his hand strokes the back of Joanna’s head ‘She has his hair’

‘Do you think they will learn the truth?’

‘No I think we are safe, we have to be careful’

‘No one can know, I have already risked everything by getting you and your father involved. You have done more for me than my own family, except Tyrion’

‘Everything will be fine there is nothing to worry about’

‘Rob I want to tell Jon, just send him a letter’

‘Y/n that letter could get in the wrong hands; it is too much of a risk. Jon, my family could be hurt if your father, Cersei learned the truth about Joanna’ he warns her as he moves his hand to cup her cheek ‘I know you care for Jon and that you wish to explain everything but we cannot; you have to trust me Y/n’

‘I trust you Rob, always have’

‘I love you Y/n, I know that you do not feel the same for me just yet but I do not wish for you to be hurt or Joanna. Jon cannot come back for you Y/n; he has taken his vows and is a knight of the watch’

His words hurt her for a moment but he was speaking the truth, he had always promised to be truthful and to speak his mind.

‘Give me time Rob, I promised you I would give you a chance and I care for you very much. Do not give up on me, I understand that Jon cannot come back but I just want to explain. I cannot bare for him to hate me, I am not like my family’

‘He will not hate you, no doubt he understands the situation we are in and that there was not other way out’ he answers her ‘I will never give up on you Y/n’

Y/n smiles as she leans forward and presses her lips against his, she soon pulls away focusing on her daughter as Rob watches on.




What do you think should happen next? Opinions please.

trail.content_raw:
Part 13

[[MORE]]

As the months past Y/n could no longer deny that she was with child, there was gossip that she fell pregnant very quickly and speculated that she and Robb had been intimate before they were married. Catelyn was not a stranger to the news of what had been talked about around Winterfell; she felt it was her duty to ask her son whether the rumours were right. Robb did as he promised for Y/n and told his mother that he and Y/n had slept together before she left for King’s Landing; that he had taken her maidenhead and the child she was carrying was his. His mother could not hide her disappointment with both Robb and Y/n, she thought her son had been raised better than sleep with the queen’s sister but she did not stay angry with the pair for long. After all it was Y/n that saved the lives of her child and her husband, she was bitter that she could no longer be with her husband, Catelyn was relieved that he was still alive.

There were times that Y/n felt saddened that she had allowed Robb to cover the fact that Jon was the father of her child. Feeling guilty that she could not tell him of her situation, if her family had learnt what had really happened then Jon’s life would be forfeit.

She and Robb had become close over the coming months, although it had taken her some time to open up, sometimes she was angry with herself that she had stopped Robb from marrying someone he really wanted to be with. They had yet to be intimate with one another, most assumed that she and Robb were madly in love with one another but were nothing but friends. Y/n had been pleased that she had married a man that respected her; he was kind and gentle with her and did not force her to do anything she was not comfortable with.

It had taken Robb some time to settle with his new role as Lord Stark of Winterfell, he often worried that he was not good enough and that his father would be disappointed in him. But both Y/n and Catelyn had reassured him that he was doing a good job and that Ned would be proud of him.

They had received a raven from Ned himself telling his family that he was safe and had arrived at Winterfell, Y/n wondered if Jon knew about her marriage to his brother and hoped that he would not judge her for her actions. She wished she could explain it all to him but it was too late for that, Y/n knew that he would have taken his vows and it would not make a difference. For Robb she had to forget and move on with her life, she had married Robb and promised that she would make the marriage work.

Y/n was almost nine moons into her pregnancy, her belly had swelled and she was finding it hard to move around Winterfell as she used to. Rob and his family had been kind to her, although at times Y/n thought she did not deserve it, after all she had been lying who the true father of her child was. At times she worried that people would find out what had happened, especially her nephew Joffrey, scared that he would send men for Jon’s head. None of her family had truly cared for her except Tyrion, he had visited her a few times since her marriage, and he stayed for several weeks before returning to King’s Landing. Both her father and Cersei sent ravens upon hearing the news that she was with child, therefore sealing her future as the Lady of Winterfell. Y/n had always dreamt that she had another family elsewhere, that in fact she had been taken as a child; which would explain why her family treated her so cruelly. It was Tyrion that was always by her side when she grew up, as everyone else would treat them as outcasts, as if they had something to be ashamed about.

Her one fear had been that she would die as her mother had in childbirth, Y/n did not want to suffer the same fate, she wanted to her child grow and thrive. She would fill her child’s life with so much love and joy, reminding them that they were loved and that they were wanted.

As her pregnancy was soon coming to an end it was advised that Y/n remain only in her rooms, not to venture outside as they worried that she may slip, fall and injury herself or her child. Rob had been there when he first felt their child move and kick against his palm. Many times she would awake and find Rob talking to her unborn child; she knew that he would be an amazing father. Y/n hoped that one day she would carry his child, to be a good wife to him as she hoped her heart would heal and open up to him.

That afternoon Y/n sat by the fire, it was growing colder, Robb was right; winter is coming. Sansa sat with her, keeping her company as they stitch together. They sat talking quietly as they shared stories with one another, Sansa telling her stories of Robb as they grew up together. As Y/n giggled along to Sansa’s story she felt a sharp pain in her stomach before she felt something wet escaping between her thighs. Sansa watches Y/n as she grimaces, a smile longer on Y/n’s face or her soft laughter filling the room.

‘Y/n, are you well?’

‘I think the baby is coming, Sansa I need you to find your mother and tell her. We need the master or Septa’

‘Now?’

‘Yes, the baby is coming please’

‘Yes, Yes I will’ Sansa nervously replies, Y/n can see the fear in the young girl’s eyes.

‘Sansa it’s going to be alright, it will be a little while before the baby will be here. There is nothing to worry about. Could you help me out of the chair I need to get to the bed?’

Sansa quickly nods as she takes Y/n’s hands and careful pulls her up out of the seat, Y/n slowly waddles to the bed as she watches Sansa rush out of the room. She quietly chuckles to herself as she unties her gown; she places it onto her wooden chest before pulling the sheets down the bed; Y/n did not wish to ruin the furs. Catelyn had once told her what it was like to give birth, but inside it not ease the nervousness she felt inside scared she would suffer the same fate as her mother. As Y/n

waited patiently on the bed Sansa quickly returned with Rob following behind her, a worried expression on his face.

‘What happened? Are you alright? Is the baby really coming’ he burst out, making Y/n smile as he moved towards her.

‘I’m fine Rob; the baby will be here soon, my waters have broken. Sansa did you find your mother?’

‘Yes..’ Sansa replies followed by a sigh as she tries to catch her breath ‘She has gone in search of the Maester and Septa?’

‘Thank you Sansa’

Rob brushes Y/n’s hair from her face as he looks into her eyes; it was as if he could sense her emotions and how she was feeling.

‘It’s going to be alright Y/n, I will not allow anything to happen to you’ he promises ‘I will stay by your side as long as it takes’

‘I do not think your mother would allow that Rob’

‘I am the Lord of Winterfell now and I wish to stay with my wife’

Her heart swells as he puts his foot down, sometimes his mother would tell him how to run Winterfell, Y/n knew she was only advising him the best way but sometimes it drove him mad. But Y/n was right Catelyn had tried to force Rob to leave their room, but there was nothing they could to make him leave. Instead he took a chair and sat by the bed as he held her hand, she could have wished for a better husband; caring and loving. Y/n knew that Rob was falling for her; she could see it in his eyes when he looked at her. She could feel herself falling for him also but hoped that she would forget about Jon and not compare the brothers.

Rob was there throughout the birth, he held onto her hand as she pushed her baby into the world, a beautiful little girl. Her daughter had a beautiful head of dark hair, she wondered if one day it would be as dark as her fathers. Rob and Y/n had already discussed what names she would like for their baby, but there was only one name that stood out for Y/n. She named her daughter Joanna after her mother, she knew her father would be furious but Y/n wished to honour her late mother.

‘She is so beautiful’ Rob told her as he watched his wife hold Joanna in her arms ‘I did not know they could be so small’

‘Would you like to hold her?’

‘What if I drop her?’

‘Rob you will not drop her, do not worry. Just copy what I am doing’ she promises as she places the small bundle in his arms. Y/n is cleaned up by the septa and her lady in waiting as the maids clear their bed, placing fresh sheets onto the mattress. Y/n watches from a distance as Rob cradles Joanna in his arms, a soft smile on his face as she sleeps quietly.

Y/n is asked if she would like a wet nurse for her a daughter but her answer is immediately no, that she wishes to nurse her own child. They are taken aback but Rob smirks as she takes Joanna and

watches curiously as the baby suckles onto her breast. It is the first time he has seen something so intimate; he had caught glimpses of Y/n naked on several occasions when she bathed but had never without her consent. The couple are left alone together as they finally breathe a sigh of relief that both mother and child are safe.

‘Thank you Rob for staying with me, I could not have done this without you’

‘I would rather be by your side than anywhere else’ he tells her, his hand strokes the back of Joanna’s head ‘She has his hair’

‘Do you think they will learn the truth?’

‘No I think we are safe, we have to be careful’

‘No one can know, I have already risked everything by getting you and your father involved. You have done more for me than my own family, except Tyrion’

‘Everything will be fine there is nothing to worry about’

‘Rob I want to tell Jon, just send him a letter’

‘Y/n that letter could get in the wrong hands; it is too much of a risk. Jon, my family could be hurt if your father, Cersei learned the truth about Joanna’ he warns her as he moves his hand to cup her cheek ‘I know you care for Jon and that you wish to explain everything but we cannot; you have to trust me Y/n’

‘I trust you Rob, always have’

‘I love you Y/n, I know that you do not feel the same for me just yet but I do not wish for you to be hurt or Joanna. Jon cannot come back for you Y/n; he has taken his vows and is a knight of the watch’

His words hurt her for a moment but he was speaking the truth, he had always promised to be truthful and to speak his mind.

‘Give me time Rob, I promised you I would give you a chance and I care for you very much. Do not give up on me, I understand that Jon cannot come back but I just want to explain. I cannot bare for him to hate me, I am not like my family’

‘He will not hate you, no doubt he understands the situation we are in and that there was not other way out’ he answers her ‘I will never give up on you Y/n’

Y/n smiles as she leans forward and presses her lips against his, she soon pulls away focusing on her daughter as Rob watches on.




What do you think should happen next? Opinions please.

As promised, here’s some inconspicuous Jonsa art. I liked the idea of another reunion scene as suggested by a couple of you in the comments of my original post and I’m a sucker for forehead kisses, so here we are.

I don’t ship them, but I like the subtle hints George teases us with in the books & I think it’s one of the better ships I’ve come across for Sansa anyway.

summary: Am I the only one not at all bothered by Kit shaving his beard?  Kit/Jon is one of the few men I find attractive with a...
body:
Am I the only one not at all bothered by Kit shaving his beard? Kit/Jon is one of the few men I find attractive with a beard.

When you grow up with mainly priests and your dad sporting beards, it kinda kills the look for you.

Hubby won’t let me forget the time he came home from a trip not having shaved the whole time and I made him shave right away.


In other news, I believe I’m getting swol from dragging my luggage around.

People have to repeat things a couple times, but I’m beginning to understand German better.

People in Munich really, really like bikes.

summary: Jon’s dark grey morality. A list
title: Jon’s dark grey morality. A list
body:
It’s no secret that dark!Jon is my favorite Jon. This side of Jon isn’t a part of him we’ll only see after he is brought back from the dead. dark!Jon is already very much present in the books and the show. 
 
Somedays, I wonder how I can be watching the same show or reading the same books as other fans. Today was one of those days. A fan disagreed with me about Jon being a bad boy. To each their own I say. It could be that my definition of ‘bad boy’ is a different then that person. A ‘bad boy’ is someone with a morality not always aligned with the status quo and considered an outsider. This fits Jon pretty well. He even says black is his favorite color!  

I’ll admit that the show whitewashed him a lot. This person claimed that book!Jon was more ‘milquetoast’ then show!Jon. I can’t get on board with that. I decided to create a list of actions that push Jon into the dark grey zone of morality. 

Things Book!Jon or book!Jon and show!Jon did that fall under grey morality or make him dark or in some cases a jerk. 

  • As a kid, Jon and Robb would play fight. They would pick heroes to be. One day Jon said he was Lord of Winterfell. When Robb said Jon could never be Lord of Winterfell. Jon remembered being so angry, he started hitting Robb and had to be pulled off.
  • Told Arya that Joffrey looked like a girl (sexist much Jon?) knowing she would probably tell Sansa, who didn’t have a much a choice in being betrothed to him. 
  • Giving Arya Needle. Aside from it being a bit dangerous. Arya could get in trouble for having it. Jon doesn’t care. Sure we cheer him for accepting Arya as she was. He did give her the tool that would set her on the path of becoming an assassin…think about that for a moment.
  • Beating the other Night’s Watch recruits to show off how good at fighting and swordsmanship he is.
  • Using Ghost to threaten another recruit (I forget his name). The guy was bullying Sam. Still, Jon, had other recruits hold the guy down and let Ghost get in his face.
  • Pulling a knife on Allister Thorne. Thorne called him a ‘traitor’s bastard’. Jon loses it. Again another example of Jon being hotheaded. It was dumb to attack Thorne. 
  • Running off to join Robb’s army
  • Killing Qhorin Halfhand. The halfhand tells him to do it. Jon could’ve refused or tried to convince him to solve their problems another way. 
  • Pretending to be a Night’s Watch deserter when he was with the Wildings.
  • Using Ygritte as part of his cover while with the Wildlings
  • Betraying the Wildlings
  • Cutting off Janos Slynt’s head
  • Helping Stannis in his battle against the Boltons
  • Mercy killing Mance against Stannis’ orders. Again this was an act of compassion. It was also out of line. An example of not following the status quo set by Stannis. 
  • Switching Gilly’s baby with Mance’s - In the process forcing Gilly into it by burning her hand. This where I think Jon really starts to cross the line into dark, dark, dark. 
  • Saying he would leave the Wall to go meet with Ramsey.

Things only show!Jon did:

  • Leaving the Wall after he is brought back. Sure he gives the reason that he died which ended his vows. Others could still consider this abandoning his post. 
  • Beating Ramsey’s face to a pulp. This is a moment we really see Jon start to lose it on the show. 
  • Choking out Littlefinger. 
  • Roughing up Theon
  • F*cking Daenerys - Even if he does ‘like’ her. (He doesn’t…but..even if he did) Wouldn’t it be more honorable to say offer to marry her? Sure it would. But Jon doesn’t do that. He f*cks her because she has dragons. 

People will say that a lot of these actions had justifiable reasons for doing them. It doesn’t change the fact that many of them are pretty harsh and/or fall under a very grey morality. The only reason we see them as justified is that we get Jon’s POV. We see his thought process. Others looking in from the outside may not see it that way. 
Many of the actions show that Jon is hotheaded, emo, and even close to being a bit crazy. Do I think Jon has a side of himself that is ‘brave, and gentle, and strong’. Yes. I think he shows this side to his very close family and a few friends. But he also has a side that is very much a bad boy. Denying this is missing a huge part of what makes Jon a great character.
